content.raw: SL Tesla [first test](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/drcsim-drcsim_2.6-gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-sl-tesla/1/) ... success! No segfaults, all tests passing.
content.html: SL Tesla first test ... success! No segfaults, all tests passing.

* SL K10: runs from 2 to 4
* Amazon: runs 1 and 2

no a single segfault.

or something quick to test: in gazebo directory 

```
valgrind --tool=memcheck --track-origins=yes --error-limit=no --read-var-info=yes --undef-value-errors=yes --trace-children=yes build/gazebo/sensors/RaySensor_TEST
```

content.raw: I cleaned up my gazebo installation, be sure log_debug is up to date, recompile but I'm still receiving the skyx clouds errors. It there something else I'm missing? arg!
content.html: I cleaned up my gazebo installation, be sure log_debug is up to date, recompile but I'm still receiving the skyx clouds errors. It there something else I'm missing? arg!

content.raw:
[First bad result](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/drcsim-drcsim_2.6-gazebo-log_debug-arenas-precise-amd64-gpu-sl-vrc/4/console) using this branch. Please, review the console so we can assure it was using this branch.

This was a job still in development, which run drcsim test suite and vrc_arenas on top. This run failed for the lack of ssh inside pbuiler so unfortunately we don't have the trace.

Failing test: *vrc_task_1_scoring.test*

I will keep trying get a new trace.
content.html:
First bad result using this branch. Please, review the console so we can assure it was using this branch.

This was a job still in development, which run drcsim test suite and vrc_arenas on top. This run failed for the lack of ssh inside pbuiler so unfortunately we don't have the trace.

Failing test: vrc_task_1_scoring.test

I will keep trying get a new trace.

content.raw:
Back to the basics, I ran the gazebo test suite with this new branch in SL K10 machine. Some tests are failing, starting by LogRecord. Maybe related (or not) to our latest failures, affecting log and transport:

Line 87 in gazebo/util/LogRecord_TEST.cc -> gazebo::common::Time::MSleep(100) 

```
#!gdb

[Thread 0x7fffe9091700 (LWP 21110) exited]
LogRecord_TEST: /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:418: T* boost::shared_ptr<T>::operator->() const [with T = gazebo::transport::Publisher]: Assertion `px != 0' failed.
[Thread 0x7fffe8890700 (LWP 21111) exited]
87	    gazebo::common::Time::MSleep(100);
(gdb) next

Program received signal SIGABRT, Aborted.
[Switching to Thread 0x7fffe9892700 (LWP 21109)]
0x00007ffff6826425 in __GI_raise (sig=<optimized out>)
    at ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:64
64	../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c: No such file or directory.
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007ffff6826425 in __GI_raise (sig=<optimized out>)
    at ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:64
#1  0x00007ffff6829b8b in __GI_abort () at abort.c:91
#2  0x00007ffff681f0ee in __assert_fail_base (fmt=<optimized out>, 
    assertion=0x7ffff75dbcc4 "px != 0", 
    file=0x7ffff75dbc98 "/usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp", line=<optimized out>, 
    function=<optimized out>) at assert.c:94
#3  0x00007ffff681f192 in __GI___assert_fail (assertion=0x7ffff75dbcc4 "px != 0", 
    file=0x7ffff75dbc98 "/usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp", line=418, 
    function=0x7ffff75dcba0 "T* boost::shared_ptr<T>::operator->() const [with T = gazebo::transport::Publisher]") at assert.c:103
#4  0x00007ffff75a2b63 in boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::transport::Publisher>::operator-> (
    this=0x6869f8) at /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:418
#5  0x00007ffff75c0567 in gazebo::util::LogRecord::PublishLogStatus (this=0x686720)
    at /home/jrivero/code/gazebo/gazebo/util/LogRecord.cc:732
#6  0x00007ffff75beeca in gazebo::util::LogRecord::Update (this=0x686720)
    at /home/jrivero/code/gazebo/gazebo/util/LogRecord.cc:485
#7  0x00007ffff75c0c26 in gazebo::util::LogRecord::Cleanup (this=0x686720)
    at /home/jrivero/code/gazebo/gazebo/util/LogRecord.cc:820
#8  0x00007ffff75da49e in boost::_mfi::mf0<void, gazebo::util::LogRecord>::operator() (
    this=0x6a1908, p=0x686720) at /usr/include/boost/bind/mem_fn_template.hpp:49
#9  0x00007ffff75d9996 in boost::_bi::list1<boost::_bi::value<gazebo::util::LogRecord*> >::operator()<boost::_mfi::mf0<void, gazebo::util::LogRecord>, boost::_bi::list0> (this=0x6a1918, 
    f=..., a=...) at /usr/include/boost/bind/bind.hpp:253
#10 0x00007ffff75d928f in boost::_bi::bind_t<void, boost::_mfi::mf0<void, gazebo::util::LogRecord>, boost::_bi::list1<boost::_bi::value<gazebo::util::LogRecord*> > >::operator() (
    this=0x6a1908) at /usr/include/boost/bind/bind_template.hpp:20
#11 0x00007ffff75d7de0 in boost::detail::thread_data<boost::_bi::bind_t<void, boost::_mfi::mf0<void, gazebo::util::LogRecord>, boost::_bi::list1<boost::_bi::value<gazebo::util::LogRecord*> > > >::run (this=0x6a1780) at /usr/include/boost/thread/detail/thread.hpp:61
```

content.raw:
While running SensorManager_TEST I've seen some segfaults in different sensors (RaySensor, CameraSensor) coming from IsActive() methods while accessing to publishers. With the form of:

```
to     function=0x4a1900 "T* boost::shared_ptr<T>::operator->() const [with T = gazebo::transport::Publisher]") at assert.c:103
#4  0x000000000046bafd in boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::transport::Publisher>::operator-> (
```

I also found a different one. I'm pretty sure that we are destroying a RaySensor Object while the method UpdateImpl() is running. UpdadeImpl() accesses to different objects (laserShape or scanPub) which are being destroyed while the method is running. segfaulting.
content.html:
While running SensorManager_TEST I've seen some segfaults in different sensors (RaySensor, CameraSensor) coming from IsActive() methods while accessing to publishers. With the form of:

to     function=0x4a1900 "T* boost::shared_ptr<T>::operator->() const [with T = gazebo::transport::Publisher]") at assert.c:103
#4  0x000000000046bafd in boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::transport::Publisher>::operator-> (

I also found a different one. I'm pretty sure that we are destroying a RaySensor Object while the method UpdateImpl() is running. UpdadeImpl() accesses to different objects (laserShape or scanPub) which are being destroyed while the method is running. segfaulting.

Running it in [jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-sl/14/consoleFull), several tests, including both for Sensors, are failing with the message: "pure virtual method called"

I caught one in my local machine: seems like we are destroying a Connection which has a pure virtual destructor.

At this point I think all the gazebo tests pass. I've been running them on 4 softlayer machines and on my desktop. The only problem I see is on the softlayer machines where the "check_*" tests for the GUI tests fail. I'm looking into this now.

I'm also switching over to run the drcsim tests, and resolving issues associated with those tests.

All tests are passing in [drcsim with this branch SL](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/drcsim-drcsim_2.6-gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-sl-tesla/15/console), please, ignore the failure state. content.raw: My manual run on vrc task 2 using RVIZ and making atlas to work does not show any problem nor performance bad impact. I scheduled the [last round](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-amazon-vrc/) #40 in jenkins to be sure all this last updates are ok. I will make an extra review to valgrind.
